label: Description
value: A field exhibiting three date palms with feathery heads, one crossing stem of the tallest and a border of a flowering vine. The palms rise from a mound or hillocks naturalistically rendered and shades in red, green, brown and some purple and yellow. Small bamboos riese from its corners. The trunks of the palms are purple, outlined in black, and they show a scaly or imbricated surface. Vines with red stems creep up around the palm bearing small flowers in red, violet, and other colors which fill the background. A very narrow border divides the main field from a border about ten inches wide decorated with curving vine, like bamboo, with red and green leaves, fruits and flowers. A wide border, about seventeen inches, at sides and eight inches at the bottom have been added and are European, probably French, block printed coton on a deep cream ground. Flowers are small, in shades of red, blue, green and brown in typical, small flower patterns of block printing from the second half of the eighteenth century. The quilt is lined with a rather coarse material, probably heavy linen, block printed in large scale designs of large red flower and meander on broken black ground. The material in unbleached and is in three and half breadths. The additions were made in Europe, France probably, and quilted. The quilting line crossing the palampore and the added French border. The stuffing is cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: painted and dyed with block-printed additions and quilting

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Roger E. Brunschwig

label: Description
value: Bedcover showing a central field with trees and a wide border with flowering vine. A tree with exposed roots rises from the point of a triangular mound, and branches about half way up appeared to be sawed off. A vine rises from the mound, crossing and recrossing the tree and bearing large flowers in shades of red and foliage in blue. The flowers exhibit much interior decoration in reserved patterns. Babbler birds are perched amid branches and two long-necked cranes are on the mound on either side of the tree. The mound is made of a series of diamond shapes with a row of red diamonds alternating with a row of blue diamonds. They bear fine inner decoration of fine sprays of flowers reserved in white. The crane at the right of the tree has a back wing which is an applied patch painted in a pattern similar but not the same as that of his companion. A wide border is between two very narrow guard borders decorated with a vine in brown bearing large heavy flowers in red, possibly lotus flowers. Pointed leaves in a chevron of red and blue with outlines of dark brown. Yellow has faded to the extent that the foliage is now blue.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: painted and dyed

Study for Maximum Mass Permitted by the 1916 New York Zoning Law, Stage 1

label: Description
value: A back lit, dramatic dark sculptural form, rectangular at base tapering into points surrounding a tall central shaft.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, stumped; brush and black ink over photostat, varnish on illustration board

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Hugh Ferriss; 1969: acquired by Museum
Study for Maximum Mass Permitted by the 1916 New York Zoning Law, Stage 2

label: Description
value: Futuristic rendering of dark, monumental complex of high-rise structures on a plinth-like base.  The central building extends vertically and is cut off by edge of sheet.  Flanking the central structure, two symmetrical towers whose sloping sides end in steep and sharp points.  Tall and narrow vertical buttresses along the facades repeat the upward thrust of the structures.  Another skyscraper building is seen in the left distance.  Rays of light emanating from the right distance and backlighting left side of the building complex emphasize the visual drama.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, stumped; brush and black ink over photostat, varnish on illustration board

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Hugh Ferriss; 1969: acquired by Museum
Study for Maximum Mass Permitted by the 1916 New York Zoning Law, Stage 3

label: Description
value: Rendering of very dark, monumental high-rise building complex with tall set back central tower, flanked by two shorter towers, each with setback upper stories that form a pyramid-shaped tops.  Background shaded with cross-hatching to create a halo effect behind the building complex in the foreground.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, stumped and erased; brush and black wash over photostat, varnish, on illustration board
Study for Maximum Mass Permitted by the 1916 New York Zoning Law, Stage 4

label: Description
value: Rendering of very dark, monumental high-rise building consisting of tall set back central tower, flanked by two smaller towers, each with set back upper stories. Dramatic "fan" of light rays in background. This is an early proposal for the set back skyscraper form that was to characterize many skyscrapers built from the mid-1920s to the ca.1950s.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, stumped, pen and black ink, brush and black wash, varnish on illustration board

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Hugh Ferriss; 1969: acquired by Museum

label: Notes
value: Rendering of very dark, monumental high-rise building consisting of tall set back central tower, flanked by two smaller towers, each with set back upper stories. label: Description
value: Square patchwork shawl with a square center containing four squares that are red, green, violet and blue. Each is isolated by black bands. The primary emphasis is the border with is a continuous arrangement of typical Kashmiri boteh forms. A narrow and fringed patchwork border is at each end.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: 2/2 twill double interlocked tapestry with stem, running and couching embroidery stitches

label: Description
value: Rectangular linen table cover with the center panel embroidered in polychrome silks and an ivory drawn work border sewn to all four sides. The embroidery depicts a large "bicho" or beast in pink, blue and gold, suckling two small beasts, with a third small beast inside the mother beast; four small beasts are scattered around. In each corner, an owl with a gold face and a pink and blue checkered body, and at each side, a double-headed bird in gold and blue. In the center panel above and below the figures is an additional band of drawn work.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidery in satin, double running, stem, cross and herringbone stitches; with drawn element work with overcasting and looping on plain weave; bobbin lace attached.

label: Notes
value: Rectangular linen table cover with the center panel embroidered in polychrome silks and an ivory drawn work border sewn to all four sides.
